message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.CC, cs.GT

Reasoning: The paper deals with graph coloring and transformations between colorings, which are topics commonly studied in discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and graph theory (cs.GT). The fact that the graphs considered are chordal suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of computational geometry (cs.CG), as chordal graphs have important geometric properties. Additionally, the use of degeneracy in the problem statement suggests that the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of data structures (cs.DS), as degeneracy is often used in the design of efficient data structures for graph algorithms. Finally, the constructive proof and linear time algorithm mentioned in the abstract suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of computational complexity (cs.CC), as it deals with the complexity of a specific graph coloring problem.
